metadata.title: CVE-2023-6205 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
It was possible to cause the use of a MessagePort after it had already beenfreed, which could potentially have led to an exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 120, Firefox ESR < 115.5.0, and Thunderbird< 115.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs102 package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
